title: Oppression Looks The Same, Dumb Mad Max 5.14.21
itunes:title: Oppression Looks The Same, Dumb Mad Max 5.14.21
description:
In episode 909, Jack and Miles are joined by Slate's Aymann Ismail to discuss police brutality towards communities of color and the parallels within the IDF's abuse of Palestinians, 'bipartisanship,' the gas shortage on the east coast, the perks of being vaccinated, the legend of Buttfucker 3000, and more!

FOOTNOTES:

  1. After Ferguson Unrest, St. Louis Police Bought Stink Weapons to Launch at Protesters
  2. U.S. Police are Being Trained by Israel—And Communities of Color Are Paying the Price
  3. A Palestinian Perspective on This Week’s Violence
  4. “If you don’t get qualified immunity now, then we’ll come back and try to get it later, but I don’t want to sees us throw out a good bill because we can’t get a perfect bill,” says House Majority Whip James Clyburn on police reform. #CNNSOTU 
  5. Ray McGuire Mayoral Endorsement Interview
  6. Manchin to support measured voting reform in lieu of sweeping Democratic proposal
  7. Officials warn people not to fill plastic bags with gasoline amid panic over gas shortage
  8. Ohio’s million-dollar idea: Lottery prizes for vaccinations
  9. Shake Shack's Offering Free Fries for Vaccinated Customers in NYC
  10. Judge Has No Patience for 'BUTTFUCKER 3000' in Zoom Court
  11. WATCH: "Buttfucker 3000" Enters Judge Jeffreys Courtroom Zoom Session
  12. LISTEN: BINKBEATS Beats Unraveled #2: Getting There by Flying Lotus

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
